Parts.A: "Yi git my book. Yi cin bring mi moa fishies, bit git nithin inimire!"

Yi hickin' fick!
  Yi bliidin' scurr'd mi hilf to dith!
Parts.B: You scared ME half to death! What are you doing up here?!

Parts.A: Ho' 'bouts yi mind yir own fickin' bidniss, ye h'ar?!
Parts.B: Wait..do you know about the "Glory of Shabam?"

Parts.A:
Nuu! It's mi brothir!
  Itin' by thos' hickin' Darfari Cannibals, hi was!
Parts.B: So... The legend behind that sword truly is lost..

Parts.A:
Yis, yis...
  <Ignatius proceeds to take up a journal and is about to toss it into the flames. On the front of it, you can just about make out a depicted sword>
What thi fick ar' yi scriamin' fir?! It's fuil fir thi flam's!
Parts.B: That looks an awful lot like the thing I am looking for! Give it here!

Parts.A: Nuuu! It's mi fickin' fire! I'll drop it into thi flam's if yi git any closir!
Parts.B: How about, I'll trade fuel for it?

Parts.A:
Trad'? Trad' is good!
  Ignatius want food! IXOTIC FISHIIS! 263!

  An' BLOO MITOL OR' FRIM SKY! 124! Ignatius sii fall at dark-tim'!

  An' fuil fir thi flam's! DRY-WOOD! Niid last long tim', Ignatius nuu climb down mountin'. 593!

  An', an', Filmor' niid frind!
  <Ignatious points at the taxidermied Ostrich>
  BRING 1!
  NOW!

Parts.B: Yes. I got everything. I think.
Parts.C: No. It was too heavy to haul it up here.

Parts.A:
Yi hickin' fickin' bird fickir, yi tryin' ti rip mi off?! Bring mi
  IXOTIC FISHIIS 263!
  BLOO MITOL OR' 124!
  DRY-WOOD 593!
  FRIND FIR FILMOR' <Ignatius points at the Taxidermied Ostrich>
  NO' GO!

<Ignatious squeals with joy as he accepts the crate of items you just brought him>
  Yi sii that, Filmor'? Ignatius stiiiill got it!
  Hir' is stopid fuil.
  <Ignatius tosses you the journal. It is indeed the journal about how to create the Glory of Old Shabam!>
Parts.B: Yes! Finally. See you never, Ignatius!
